definition: to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus

sentences.english: You're going to need to be tough in general, sometimes downright ruthless.
sentences.chinese: 你需要很强悍，有些时候甚至要残酷无情。

sentences.english: Anyone who likes watching people suffer is cruel .
sentences.chinese: 喜欢看到别人受苦的人是残酷无情的。

sentences.english: The cruelty of his words cut her like a knife.
sentences.chinese: 他说的那些残酷无情的话对她就像刀割一样。

sentences.english: Many instances of cruelty and inhumanity can be found on both sides.
sentences.chinese: 其实交战双方皆有许多残酷无情的劣迹。

sentences.english: The consequences of war are dire, the sacrifices immeasurable .
sentences.chinese: 军事战争的后果残酷无情，牺牲难以估量。

sentences.english: Fascists is the most ruthless enemy of the people.
sentences.chinese: 法西斯是人民最残酷无情的敌人。

sentences.english: The on-line world can be particularly cruel and harsh.
sentences.chinese: 网络世界可以说是特别的残酷无情。
但唐古拉又是残酷无情的。

sentences.english: Such a cruel, heartless charge -- I never had seen Cochin China!
sentences.chinese: 竟有这样一种残酷无情的指控。

sentences.english: I had felt the almost ruthless power of the man.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉到了这个人的近乎残酷无情的力量。

sentences.english: You have played the hoax on yourself, and it is your ways which are cruel.
sentences.chinese: 你们愚弄了自己，你们的方式才残酷无情。

sentences.english: He eliminates evidence and witnesses with brutal, emotionless efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 他残酷无情地抹消证人和证物。

sentences.english: They were all masters of torah, proficient in fuses, and brutal and wealthy person.
sentences.chinese: 他们都是深通教律，精于谋略，残酷无情而富有的人。

definition: lit. to kill people like scything flax (idiom)/fig. to kill people like flies

pinyin: chi1 ren2 bu4 tu3 gu3 tou2
